properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 2 at 11:33AM EST until January 3 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Southwest
Lower Michigan...

Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County
Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County
Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County
Muskegon River at Newaygo affecting Newaygo County
Muskegon River at Bridgeton affecting Newaygo County

.Rivers continue to respond to recent heavy rain and snow melt.  River levels at
forecast points on the Grand River are expected to crest in the coming days,
while river levels will continue to fall at Newaygo and Bridgeton along the
Muskegon river.  At Maple Rapids, the Maple River is expected to gradually fall
over the coming week. The following forecast is based on observed
and forecast 48 hour precipitation.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Muskegon River at Bridgeton.
* until Friday morning.
* at 11:00 AM Thursday the stage was 13.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.0 feet.
* Minor Flooding is occurring and Minor Flooding is forecast.
* Forecast, the river will continue rising to near 13.2 feet by this
afternoon.  The river will fall below flood stage after midnight
tonight.
* Impact, at 13.0 feet...Water overflows the banks into wooded areas.
* Flood history, this crest compares to a previous crest of 13.4 feet
on Apr 19 2019.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Motorists should not attempt to drive around
barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.

Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local
radio... television... or NOAA Weather Radio station for further
information.

Additional weather and river information can be found on our homepage
at www.weather.gov/grr
